html:
#inmemory#

Question 1

All of the following are good reasons for prototyping except which one?

Question 2

Which of the following statements about low-fidelity prototyping are correct (Select all that apply).

Question 3

Which of the following statements about paper prototyping are correct (Select all that apply).

Question 4

Which of the following are drawbacks of going into too much detail with tool-based prototyping (select all that apply)?

Question 5

Why should a designer ever include physical low fidelity prototyping in the design process? (Select all that apply)

Question 6

You are considering a tool for a prototyping project. You already have a paper prototype for a mobile app, but would like to make it easier to share and test. Which tool would you choose and why?

Question 7

Which of these design challenges is likely to run into the limits of prototyping?

#inmemory#

Question 1

Following general principles for good visual design is helpful because (select the best answer):

Question 2

Which of the following is the best example of an Interaction Design Pattern?

Question 3

Which of the following statements about Google’s Material Design are true? (Select all that apply)

Question 4

How are the Gestalt principle of proximity and the First Law of Geography related?

Question 5

Consider a text editor user interface that has a red “bold” button and a green “italics” button. Which of the follow best describes the potential problem(s) with these design choices, according to the lecture on Color and Consistency?

Question 6

Which of the following is a true statement about the task of localizing cloud-based photo software for a new national culture?

Question 7

Which of the following statements about Apple’s Human Interface Guidelines is true? (select one):

Question 8

Which of the following are good strategies while getting feedback and critiques from others? (Select all that apply)

#inmemory#

Question 1

What lesson do we learn from the examples of curb cuts and closed captioning?

Question 2

What is the best way to address color blindness in interfaces?

Question 3

What challenges exist in making interfaces operate correctly with screen readers?

Question 4

How do we design an interface to be usable by users with attention deficit and hyperactivity disorder? Choose the best answer.

Question 5

Motor limitations can cause problems with user interfaces for a number of different reasons. Which of the following design features are likely to help a user with motor limitations?

Question 6

Standard platform tools (e.g., for Windows, MacOS, Android, iOS) have an amazing collection of accessibility settings. All of the following are real examples except one. Which one is not real?

Question 7

What is the most appropriate way to refer to “older adults”?

Question 8

Which of the following put Piaget’s stages in the correct order (from earliest stage to latest stage)?

Question 9

Designing for children may improve the accessibility of any interface because it also forces the designer to consider (select all that apply)...

Question 10

Which of the following *is* a true statement about designing for a population with broad socioeconomic status differences?

#inmemory#

Question 1

Which of the following statements about responsive web design is most accurate?

Question 2

Automotive interfaces such as steering wheels and the position of accelerator and brake pedals are interface examples that benefit from which key design principle?

Question 3

Which of the following are particular challenges for automotive interface design?

Question 4

When should privacy and security be considered in the design of IoT systems?

Question 5

Which of the following is an example of a microprocessor board used in physical computing? (select all that apply)

Question 6

What is the main design challenge of designing software for smartwatches?

#inmemory#

How to use Material Design in your apps:

https://developer.android.com/training/material/ and https://developer.android.com/training/material/get-started.html and https://www.udacity.com/course/material-design-for-android-developers--ud862 and https://material.google.com/

Introductory videos:

  1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p4gmvHyuZzw

  2. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YaG_ljfzeUw

  3. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XOcCOBe8PTc

Example Component:

  1. Floating Action Button

  2. Cards

  3. Dialogs

  4. Lists

  5. Menus

  6. Pickers

  7. Text fields

Example Patterns:

  1. Confirmation and acknowledgement

  2. Navigation Drawer

  3. Notifications

  4. Settings
